snippet.description: The Judiciary Act of 1789. September 24, 1789. 1 Stat. 73. CHAP. XX. - An Act to establish the Judicial Courts of the United States. SECTION 1. Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the United States of America in Congress assembled, That the supreme court of the United ...

snippet.title: Judiciary Act of 1789 \- Social Studies for Kids
snippet.description: Definition: 1789 law that created the Judicial Branch of the federal government. Among the things provided for in the Act: the number of members of the Supreme Court (6)

snippet.title: Federal Judiciary Act (1789) - Welcome to OurDocuments.gov
snippet.description: One of the first acts of the new Congress was to establish a Federal court system through the Judiciary Act signed by President Washington on September 24, 1789.

snippet.title: Judiciary Act of 1789 legal definition of Judiciary Act of ...
snippet.description: Judiciary Act of 1789. The Judiciary Act of 1789 established the lower federal courts. Under Article III, Section 1, of the U.S. Constitution, "The judicial Power of the United States, shall be vested in one supreme Court, and in such inferior Courts as the Congress may from time to time ordain ...

snippet.title: Judiciary Act of 1789 (United States law) -- Encyclopedia ...
snippet.description: Judiciary Act of 1789, in full 1789 Judiciary Act, act establishing the organization of the U.S. federal court system, which had been sketched only in general terms in the U.S. Constitution.

snippet.title: The Judiciary Act of 1789 \- Infoplease.com
snippet.description: In the Judiciary Act of 1789, the First Congress provided the detailed organization of a federal judiciary that the Constitution had sketched only in general terms.

snippet.title: Judiciary Act Of 1789 \- Laws
snippet.description: One aspect that the Judiciary Act of 1789 covered was the creation of levels of courts. The Act also established circuit courts and district courts.

snippet.title: The judiciary act of 1789......?
snippet.description: The United States Judiciary Act of 1789 (ch. 20, 1 Stat. 73-93) was a landmark statute adopted on September 24, 1789 in the first session of the First United States Congress establishing the U.S. federal judiciary.
